abstract.text: Informs the table view that the number of records in its data source has changed.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This method allows the table view to update the scrollers in its scroll view without actually reloading data into the table view. It’s useful for a data source that continually receives data in the background over a period of time, in which case the table view can remain responsive to the user while the data is received.
protocol specification for information on the messages an
object sends to its data source.

-based table views this method should be avoided. The table will query the data source for the new number of rows, and properly insert (or remove) rows at the end of the table as necessary with an animation.
-based table views this method tells the table that there may be more (or less) rows available and to reload state based on that information.
This method does not work for

subclass.
A view that uses a row-and-column format to display hierarchical data like directories and files that can be expanded and collapsed.
A set of related records, displayed in rows that represent individual records and columns that represent the attributes of those records.

The table view’s column autoresizing style.
Returns the indexes of the table view’s columns that intersect the specified rectangle.
Returns a rectangle locating the cell that lies at the intersection of the specified column and row.

have changed height.
Informs the table view that the number of records in its data source has changed.
Returns the rectangle containing the column at the specified index.
Returns the rectangle containing the row at the specified index.
Marks the table view as needing redisplay, so it will reload the data for visible cells and draw the new values.
Returns the index of the row the specified point lies in.
Returns a range of indexes for the rows that lie wholly or partially within the vertical boundaries of the specified rectangle.
Resizes the last column so the table view fits exactly within its enclosing clip view.
Sizes the  table view based on a uniform column autoresizing style.
Properly sizes the table view and its header view and marks it as needing display.
The layout direction of the user interface.
A set of methods that a table view uses to provide data to a table view and to allow the editing of the table view’s data source object.
Returns the number of records managed for
by the data source object.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
